revision.text:
[[Image:PB-PIC_Front.jpg|thumb|right|PB-Style PIC]]
The PB-Style [[PIC]] was the second style introduced by Juniper, originally for the [[M160]] platform. The PB style was later adopted for the [[M40e]] and [[M320]], and continues to be used for [[type-1]] and [[type-2]] [[PIC]]s on the [[T-series]] platforms.
The PB-Style PICs are used for both [[type-1]] and [[type-2]] interfaces. When used for [[type-1]], plastic "rails" as used as spacers to expand the width of the card to fit the PB faceplate, when used for [[type-2]], the PIC electronics are physically wider than the [[type-1]]. The [[type-1]] electronics are the same as the [[P-Style PIC]] and [[PE-Style PIC]], only the faceplate and plastic rails differ.
PB-Style PICs use two large thumbscrews handle insertion and removal of the PIC within the FPC.
[[Image:PB-PIC-type1.jpg|400px|left|Type-1 PB PIC]] [[Image:PB-PIC-type2.jpg|400px|right|Type-2 PB PIC]]
